CSCPlots 0.0.0.9000
  • Reference
  • Articles
    • CSCPlots Tutorial 2

Plot a score overlaid on a supplied t-SNE or PCA generated using a cancer single-cell population expression matrix; a range in the score defined by 2 thresholds is coloured grey and light grey below the lower threshold.

plot_field_with_thresholds.Rd

For printing tSNEs or PCAs with additional field (e.g. individual gene) specified by fieldName overlaid with an additional colour range in grey specified by thresholdOne & thresholdTwo parameters (e.g. useful for lower gene expression range such as 0 to 1). In grey >thresholdOne && < thresholdTwo; lgrey <= thresholdOne; coloured >= thresholdTwo. It can be also be used to label or colour individual or small groups of cells to assist identification of subpopulations of interest e.g. groups of cancer stem cells.

plot_field_with_thresholds(
  myData,
  xAxisName,
  yAxisName,
  fieldName,
  fullFieldName,
  thresholdOne,
  thresholdTwo,
  runName,
  outDir,
  labelPositions = NULL,
  colourPositions = NULL,
  labelField = NULL,
  highestOnTop = NULL,
  point_size = NULL
)

Arguments

myData

Data frame describing t-SNE or PCA and score/s including the score to print.
xAxisName

Name of column in myData that describes x-axis info for plot e.g. "Y1" in a t-SNE.
yAxisName

Name of column in myData that describes y-axis info for plot e.g. "Y2" in a t-SNE.
fieldName

Name of column in myData that contains the field for colouring the plot with.
fullFieldName

Full name of fieldName to use in the plot title e.g. full HUGO gene name.
thresholdOne

Lower value to print cells in grey. Cells <= this are in light grey.
thresholdTwo

Upper value to print cells in grey. Cells > thresholdOne && < thresholdTwo are grey.
runName

Run name, e.g. 'tSNE_070'; will be used in the title of the plot and the output tif name.
outDir

Output directory to use.
labelPositions

Optional: Row number/s of myData i.e. cell positions, to print cell labels for.
colourPositions

Optional: Row number/s of myData i.e. cell positions, to highlight cells (in black).
labelField

Optional: If labelPositions parameter has been provided, labelField can provide the name of another categorical variable within a column of myData to label the defined labelPositions. E.g. use labelPositions to define malignant cell clusters to be labelled, and use labelField to label those cells with additional clinical info if available such as patient age, sex, or treament/s given.
highestOnTop

Optional: Set to TRUE to print highest scoring cells on top of lower scoring cells.
point_size

Optional: Size of points in plot.

Value

No return value.

Contents
